Params: Rosetta's massive frame arcs into the air and falls into a warehouse in the port.
Rosetta stands up again, her wings radiating a blinding burst of light.
One last strike. One way or the other.
Well then, let's put an end to this.
Alpha readies her battle stance in a rare display of form.
The tension between them has reached the climax—
But just as both parties are about to unleash their strikes...
I've no intention to take unnecessary lives.
Evan has not noticed that the fully-corrupted Rosetta behind him has no intention to stop.
In a flash, Rosetta is defeated, losing her mobility and consciousness.
Only Evan and Alpha remain in the building.
They stare at each other for a moment, then Alpha puts away her weapon.
As if a switch has been flicked, the boy throws himself onto Rosetta's body, screaming her name.
And as Alpha is about to leave—
I want to leave myself a worthy opponent. If she's strong enough to survive that is...
Alpha suddenly pauses as she passes by Evan.
One more thing. During her last strike...
After confirming Alpha's departure, Evan continues to call out to Rosetta.
...Not until this moment has everyone come.
However, in the ocean depths unbeknownst to the others...
Faintly it flickers deep within the depths...
Everyone, I've detected... an extremely powerful signal from an Inver-Device!
Rosetta's M.I.N.D. is stabilizing...? No, it's her consciousness... recovering.
...How's that possible? It's even harder than removing the Punishing Virus...
Enduring the pain, Lee sits off to the side.
Whatever the reason... Her M.I.N.D. is within a stable threshold!
Hurry! Filter out the Punishing Virus in Rosetta!
But... We're in too remote of an area to have something for that. Unless...
Everyone looks at the sea simultaneously...
Lucia finally manages to climb her way back onto the shore...
Lucia notices that the crowd's gaze does not fall on her, but on the sea behind her.
At the other end of the sea...
